label: ABCA7
synonyms: ATP-binding cassette, sub-family A, member 7
short_summary: ABCA7 is a member of the highly conserved superfamily of ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporters.

label: ADAM10
synonyms: ADAM-10, AD10, MADM, HsT18717, A Disintegrin and Metalloproteinase10, CD156c
short_summary: ADAM10 stands for A Disintegrin and Metalloproteinase 10.

label: Amyloid-β (Aβ)
synonyms: Abeta
short_summary: Amyloid-β (Aβ) peptides are produced from the regulated intramembrane proteolysis of the amyloid precursor protein (APP).

label: APOE
synonyms: Apolipoprotein E, LPG, LDLCQ5, AD2
short_summary: Apolipoprotein E is a secreted apolipoprotein involved in lipid metabolism.

label: APP
synonyms: (Amyloid Precursor Protein), amyloid beta (A4) precursor protein
short_summary: The amyloid precursor protein (APP) is central to the study of Alzheimer’s disease.

label: BACE1
synonyms: beta-secretase 1, beta-Site amyloid beta A4 precursor protein-cleaving enzyme, memapsin-2 (membrane-associated aspartic protease 2), aspartyl protease 2 (ASP2), HSPC104
short_summary: BACE1 encodes a transmembrane aspartyl protease responsible for β-secretase processing of the amyloid precursor protein (APP).

label: Bridging integrator 1 (BIN1)
synonyms: amphiphysin 2, AMPH2, AMPHL, SH3P9
short_summary: Bridging integrator 1 (BIN1) is a widely expressed adaptor protein that is part of the Bin1/amphiphysin/RVS167 (BAR) family.

label: C9ORF72
synonyms: chromosome 9 open reading frame 72, FTDALS, ALSFTD
short_summary: The most common mutation for familial frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is in the chromosome 9 open reading frame 72 gene (C9ORF72).

label: CD33
synonyms: p67, SIGLEC3, SIGLEC-3
short_summary: CD33 is a transmembrane receptor of the innate immune system that is expressed on the surface of peripheral monocytes and microglial cells in the brain.

label: Clusterin
synonyms: apolipoprotein J (ApoJ), sulfated glycoprotein-2 (SGP-2), secreted glycoprotein gp80, complement-associated protein SP-40, complement lysis inhibitor (CLI), testosterone- repressed prostate message 2 (TRPM-2)
short_summary: Clusterin is a highly conserved glycoprotein that functions primarily as an extracellular chaperone.

label: Complement Receptor 1 (CR1)
synonyms: Complement component (3b/4b) receptor 1, CD35 antigen, C3b/C4b receptor, C3-binding protein, Knops blood group antigen
short_summary: The complement receptor 1 (CR1) gene encodes a transmembrane glycoprotein that functions in the innate immune system.

label: FUS
synonyms: Fused in Sarcoma, Translated in Liposarcoma (TLS), FUS/TLS, HNRNPP2, ALS6
short_summary: Originally identified as a pro-oncogene, FUS came to the attention of neurodegenerative disease research in 2009, when mutations in this gene were linked to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).

label: GBA
synonyms: Lysosomal glucocerebrosidase, acid β-glucosidase, GBA1, D-glucosyl-N-acylsphingosine glucohydrolase, GCase
short_summary: Homozygous mutations in the GBA gene cause Gaucher’s disease, the most common lysosomal storage disorder.

label: Leucine-rich repeat kinase 2 (LRRK2)
synonyms: PARK8, dardarin
short_summary: Missense mutations in LRRK2 were first identified as a cause of Parkinson’s disease (PD) in 2004.

label: PICALM
synonyms: phosphatidylinositol binding clathrin assembly protein, clathrin assembly lymphoid-myeloid leukemia (CALM) protein, LAP, CLTH
short_summary: PICALM is an accessory protein in the endocytic pathway.

label: Presenilin-1 (PSEN1)
synonyms: PS1, PS-1, S182, AD3
short_summary: Presenilins were originally identified as the genes harboring mutations that cause autosomal-dominant Alzheimer’s disease.

label: Presenilin-2 (PSEN2)
synonyms: PS2, AD4, AD3L, STM2, CMD1V
short_summary: Presenilin-2 (PSEN2) is one of two highly homologous presenilin genes expressed in vertebrates.

label: Progranulin
synonyms: GRN, PGRN, granulin precursor, granulin, proepithelin, PC cell-derived growth factor (PCDGF), GP88, PEPI, CLN11, Granulin Epithelin Precursor (GEP)
short_summary: Progranulin burst on the scene of neurodegenerative disease as a major genetic cause of frontotemporal dementia (FTD) in 2006, only months before TDP-43 was identified as the main protein constituent of the histopathological lesions in the same patients.

label: SNCA (α-synuclein)
synonyms: PD1, NACP, PARK1, PARK
short_summary: Point mutations in the α-synuclein gene (SNCA), as well as duplication or triplication of wild-type SNCA, cause autosomal-dominant Parkinson’s disease.

label: SORLA (SORL1)
synonyms: Sorting protein-related receptor containing LDLR class-A repeats, Sortilin-related receptor, SORLA1, LR11, LRP9, gp250, C11orf32
short_summary: The sortilin-related receptor SORLA is an endocytic receptor that belongs to the vacuolar protein sorting 10 (VPS10) domain receptor family.

label: Tau (MAPT)
synonyms: TAU, MSTD, MAPTL, Microtubule-associated protein tau
short_summary: Tau has been the subject of study since its discovery in 1975.

label: TDP-43
synonyms: TAR DNA-binding protein 43, TDP43, TARDBP, ALS10, transactive response DNA-binding protein of 43 kDa
short_summary: In 2006, TAR DNA-binding protein 43 (TDP-43) was identified as the cardinal protein in the most common subtypes of frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).

label: TREM2
synonyms: Triggering receptor expressed on myeloid cells 2, Trem2a, Trem2b, Trem2c, TREM-2
short_summary: Triggering receptor expressed on myeloid cells 2 (TREM2) is a receptor of the innate immune system expressed on microglia, macrophages, dendritic cells, and osteoclasts.
